summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated April 19, 1968, identifies James Earl Ray (born March 10, 1928, in Illinois) as the accused assassin. The cable provides a detailed physical description, including height, weight, eye color, hair color, and scars, and notes his aliases (James McBride, James Walton, W. C. Herron, and James O'Connor). It also mentions Ray's U.S. Army service, discharge due to ineptitude, past confinement in a mental hospital, employment history, and long criminal record involving burglary, armed robbery, and forgery; he has been missing from the Missouri State Penitentiary since April 23, 1967. The cable states that Ray is considered armed and extremely dangerous, with his current whereabouts unknown, and that photos are being sent for liaison purposes.
title: Identification of Accused Assassin as James Earl Ray
